events.message: The customer reported a motor vehicle collision that occurred on February 28th involving their sedan and a truck at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under the 'Auto Accident' cluster due to reported car collision and damages.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the auto accident claim and contact the insured for further details.
Customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission, confirming the case is now in process for assessment.
Requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and statements from witnesses to support the investigation of the accident.
Customer uploaded requested documents including police report and multiple photos showing the extent of collision damages.
Investigator began reviewing submitted materials and contacting involved parties for a comprehensive evaluation of the accident.
Investigation concluded with determination that the customer was not at fault and vehicle damages are consistent with the collision.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car expenses was prepared and sent to the customer for review.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the quick and fair handling of the claim.
Claim manager approved the settlement agreement and authorized payment issuance to the customer’s designated bank account.
Payment for approved settlement was processed and transferred to the insured, covering all agreed-upon repair costs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and customer’s confirmation of satisfaction.
Case documents were archived in the system for future reference and record-keeping pursuant to company policy.
